column4: I need to reinstall XP... I have a dual boot setup...  I plan on using the Super Grub Boot CD...  Is there anything I should check or make note of BEFORE I reinstall XP.  Like which partition is swap and which one has Ubuntu...
make sure you back up all your data in case something goes wrong.
Nothing in Ubuntu I can do without..
I have everything on a shared partition
windows might erase your linux bootloader so you might need to use a live cd to chroot into you linux installation to reinstall the bootloader.
That is why I was going to use the SGR cd..
I am sure it with change the mbr
and setting root user is not advised

if all you're doing is reinstalling windows then all you'll probably need to worry about is data on the windows partition getting erased and the boot loader.  If you're planning on changing your partitioning scheme things would get more complex.

nomin..  nuthing on the XP partition I need to woory about... I keep everything on other partitions and drives...  How about a quick refresh on what to use in UB to see my HD0 SD0 etc so I can point grub to the right partition.
sudo fdisk -l
thanks
make sure windows doesn't try to format your linux partitions.
is that dash EYE or Ell
l and in lamb
thanks... I am comfortable that I will not overwrite my partition table..
the "l" stands for "list" because you want to list your partitions
when I reinstalled windows I disabled the bootloader first.  I'm using a different distro with my bootloader though and I don't think you can disable the bootloader with ubuntu.
Wish me luck... I have a cool XP cd that lets me do an unattended install in 7 minutes...
btw, I can do just about anything on linux now that I can do on windows.
agreed, except that I get paid to work in windows...
